docs.snippet: The fact that the United States has sent munitions and missionaries to the same Latin-American countries was deplored yesterday by Dr. Samuel Guy Inman, secretary of the Committee on Cooperation in Latin America, in his report to the committee's...
docs.lead_paragraph: The fact that the United States has sent munitions and missionaries to the same Latin-American countries was deplored yesterday by Dr. Samuel Guy Inman, secretary of the Committee on Cooperation in Latin America, in his report to the committee's annual meeting at 254 Fourth Avenue.

headline.main: SCORES ARMS SALES TO LATIN AMERICA; Dr. Inman Deplores Sending Missionaries and Munitions to Same Countries. WARNS OF RED DANGER Protestant Campaign Throughout South America Is Urged Upon Mission Body at Meeting.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 16. -- The Bolivians today renewed their offensive against Fort Nanawa or President Ayala, making several attacks which Paraguayan War Ministry communiques said were repulsed with heavy losses to the Bolivians.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 16. -- The Bolivians today renewed their offensive against Fort Nanawa or President Ayala, making several attacks which Paraguayan War Ministry communiques said were repulsed with heavy losses to the Bolivians.

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 21. -- The Bolivian Government, according to reliable information received here today, has ordered the Bolivian delegation to the League of Nations to inform it that Paraguay is maufacturing asphyxiating war gas in the botanical...
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 21. -- The Bolivian Government, according to reliable information received here today, has ordered the Bolivian delegation to the League of Nations to inform it that Paraguay is maufacturing asphyxiating war gas in the botanical park at Asuncion under the direction of a "European chemist."
docs.abstract: Bolivia wants League of Nations informed that Paraguay is making war gas; fighting renewed; peace efforts

headline.main: BOLIVIA SAYS FOE IS MAKING WAR GAS; Orders Geneva Delegation to Inform League With Aim of Checking Paraguay. FIGHTING IS RENEWED Argentina, Brazil and Chile Vie With Each Other to Bring About Peace in Chaco.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 21. -- The Foreign Ministers of Argentina, Brazil and Chile have begun a keen diplomatic contest for leadership in terminating the Chaco hostilities and for the international prestige that would accompany success in accomplishing...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 21. -- The Foreign Ministers of Argentina, Brazil and Chile have begun a keen diplomatic contest for leadership in terminating the Chaco hostilities and for the international prestige that would accompany success in accomplishing what the commission of neutrals at Washington failed to accomplish.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: According to yesterday's classified statement of the Department of Commerce, this country's imports of gold during December, which amounted to $100,872,133 (the second largest Import showing for any month in the country's history), included...
docs.lead_paragraph: According to yesterday's classified statement of the Department of Commerce, this country's imports of gold during December, which amounted to $100,872,133 (the second largest Import showing for any month in the country's history), included consignments from thirty-three separate countries.
